title: Logo webhosting company W3SERVE
content:
Hello everybody,

First of all I would like to say that I love this site. I'm relatively new here, this is my second post, but checking Typophile several times a day is already a daily routine for me.

I designed this logotype for a webhosting company called W3SERVE. The letters are designed by myself. I think they are appropriate for this type of company. They are robust, a thing you also want to expect from a server, and are easily associated with computers and the internet.

The client already saw the design and liked it, but maybe you have some critique and/or suggestions. Everything is welcome.

David

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [W3SERVE.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20131020062409/http:/typophile.com/files/W3SERVE.jpg) | 32.91 KB |
author: dollamas

comments.content:
Is "Weserve" what you were going for?

I would tend to want to take this even closer to a pixel grid, and make all the counters the same optical width as the strokes. I might try to bring more diagonals in too, since the one in the V seems a little lonely.

That said I think what you've got already functions admirably, and if the client likes it that's a strong argument to leave everything the way it is!
